required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Postoperative Score Predictive of the Prognosis of Acetabular Fractures
clinical_study.official_title: Postoperative Score Predictive of the Prognosis of Acetabular Fractures

brief_summary.textblock: Acetal fractures are joint fractures that occur in the hip. These fractures affect the functional prognosis of the hip in the short, medium and long term. In the acetabulum fractures operated on, there is a radiological score in the literature allowing the prognosis to be predicted depending on the quality of the postoperative reduction. This score is based on the quality of postoperative reduction assessed on pelvic radios. In addition, the thresholds for poor / good results were determined empirically.

primary_outcome.description: This ouctome corresponds to the total hip prosthesis.

secondary_outcome.description: This ouctome corresponds to the postoperative complication rate.
This ouctome corresponds to the delay of total hip replacement.

study_pop.textblock: The patients were operated on for an acetabulum fracture within the Paris Saint Joseph Hospital Group, between January 2004 and December 2014, with a minimum post-operative follow-up of 2 years.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient whose age is â‰¥ 18 years
- Patient operated on for an acetabular fracture at the GHPSJ between January 2004 and December 2014
- Patient with a minimum postoperative follow-up of 2 years
- French-speaking patient
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient treated conservatively.
- Patient under guardianship or curatorship
- Patient deprived of liberty
- Patient under legal protection
- Patient objecting to the use of his medical data as part of this study
